behaviours.name: Artificial Urgency Creation
behaviours.description: Creating a sense of urgency to encourage immediate action from students.

behaviours.name: Support Mechanism Integration
behaviours.description: Integrating support mechanisms into the educational planning process to enhance student retention.

behaviours.name: Excessive Promise-Making
behaviours.description: Making promises that may not be fulfilled, which can lead to student dissatisfaction.

behaviours.name: Value Proposition Articulation
behaviours.description: Clearly articulating the value proposition to students to enhance their understanding and commitment.

behaviours.name: Adaptive Communication Style
behaviours.description: Adapting communication styles to better connect with students and meet their needs.

behaviours.name: Value Proposition Reinforcement Response
behaviours.description: Reinforcing the value proposition in response to student inquiries or concerns.

behaviours.name: Adaptive Collaboration Style
behaviours.description: Collaborating with students in a way that adapts to their individual needs and preferences.

behaviours.name: Responsive Adaptability
behaviours.description: Being responsive and adaptable to changing student needs and circumstances.

support_mechanism_integration_patterns.description: Effective consultants strategically introduce relevant post-enrollment support services as integral parts of the educational planning process, clearly positioning these resources to address anticipated student needs.

comparison.consultant_script: After enrollment, our Student Coaches can help you develop detailed weekly study schedules that work with your rotating shifts.
Now the student advisors are available seven days a week, Monday to Friday. They can assist you with information questions, academic skills, study support, research writing, and technical support.

Moving forward as well, in terms of the support available to you, you’ll get your dedicated student advisor team who are here to support you. They’re available seven days a week via email, phone, and online learning. They’ll also reach out to you weekly. They will also check in with your learning needs and goals, and they will become a consistent support to you – essentially your teacher and they’ll be your first point of contact to assist with the classroom content and the assessment tasks. They’re also available seven days a week via email and Zoom.
